summary: Barbara J. Robinson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to January 1979. The documents list her name, and in some cases, her social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. The documents indicate that she was employed by the SCAS during the period they were actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Barbara J. Robinson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work.
